definition[0]: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted
example[0]: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
example[1]: The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
example[2]: He will resume training as soon as the injury is better.
definition[1]: if an activity or process resumes, it starts again after a pause
definition[2]: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details
example[4]: a brief résumé of the day’s events
definition[3]: a short written account of your education and your previous jobs that you send to an employer when you are looking for a new job
definition[4]: to start to do something again after a period of rest or an interruption
example[5]: Profit-taking resumed as the yen began to lose ground.
example[6]: The company said it won’t resume its efforts to sell assets until gold prices rise.
